record.title: ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, DECEMBER 13, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, DECEMBER 13, 2007 -- (Senate - December 12, 2007)

[Page: S15378]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 8:30 a.m., Thursday, December 13; that on Thursday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 2419, with the time until 9:15 a.m. equally divided and controlled between the leaders or their designees for debate only; that at 9:15 a.m., the Senate vote in relation to the Dorgan amendment No. 3695, as modified, as provided for under a previous order; that upon disposition of the Dorgan amendment, there be 2 minutes of debate prior to a cloture vote on the motion to concur with respect to H.R. 6.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
